channel.title: [PI] HeadIcons
channel.description:
Hey, I'm having problems with Headicons for my server. This is in my login method in Client.java
[code]Server.npcHandler.spawnNpc(this, 945, 3095, 3108, 0, 1, 0, 0, 0, 0, false, true);[/code]
But everytime a new player logs in, it makes a new RuneScape Guide. I need there to be only 1. Please help?
Tried this aswell in the login method:
[code]getPA().drawHeadicon(1, 945, 0, 0);[/code]
No arrow appears.

item.title: [PI] HeadIcons
item.dc:creator: @matiasmunk2 matiasmunk2
item.description:
@matiasmunk2 wrote:

It’s Interface class :S, so I got a little confused there, sorry.
Anyways ClickNPC class has 16 breaks… Idk which one to add it in.

Edit: ClickNPC class, http://pastebin.com/vBZttYFZ.

Read full topic

Anyways, there’s thousands of breaks in ClickNPC.java, which ones ?[/quote]

Import your Interface class.

Below your package thing, add

import DIRECTORIES.Interface;

Mine, for example it really isn’t, is in server.model.players, so I do,

import server.model.players.Interface;

item.dc:creator: @arham_4 arham 4
item.description:
@arham_4 wrote:

[quote=“matiasmunk2, post:12, topic:465973”]src\server\game\players\Client.java:276: error: cannot find symbol getInterfaces().createEntityIcon(this, IndexOfTh eNpc); ^ symbol: variable IndexOfTheNpc location: class Client src\server\game\players\Client.java:276: error: cannot find symbol getInterfaces().createEntityIcon(this, IndexOfTh eNpc); ^ symbol: method getInterfaces() location: class Client Note: Some input files use unchecked or unsafe operations. Note: Recompile with -Xlint:unchecked for details. 2 errors Tryk på en vilkårlig tast for at fortsætte . . .

Am I missing something?

Edit: Forget the first error, look at the second one, forgot to change it to 945.[/quote]
Oh, add this somewhere in Client.java

public Interfaces inter = new Interface(); public Interfaces getInterfaces() { return inter; }

[hr]

matiasmunk2:

Edit: Forget the first error, look at the second one, forgot to change it to 945.

Did you even read

[quote=“arham 4, post:9, topic:465973”]Also, you need to know the INDEX of the npc. The index is NOT the npc ID, the index is the index. To do this, go to ClickNPC and find

break;

Above that, add

System.out.println("Npc index: " + c.npcIndex);

Now do that again.

Now, again search for

break;

But now, above that, add

System.out.println("Npc index: " + c.npcClickIndex);

Now do that two more times and now, when you click the npc, the cmd will say the npc index. That is the id to use when using the createEntityIcon.

P.S: RS Guide is mostly 6.[/quote]

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] HeadIcons
item.dc:creator: @arham_4 arham 4
item.description:
@arham_4 wrote:

matiasmunk2:

No arrow appears above the npc.

Change

getPA().drawHeadicon(1, 945, 0, 0);

To

getInterfaces().createEntityIcon(this, IndexOfTheNpc);

Also, you need to know the INDEX of the npc. The index is NOT the npc ID, the index is the index. To do this, go to ClickNPC and find

break;

Above that, add

System.out.println("Npc index: " + c.npcIndex);

Now do that again.

Now, again search for

break;

But now, above that, add

System.out.println("Npc index: " + c.npcClickIndex);

Now do that two more times and now, when you click the npc, the cmd will say the npc index. That is the id to use when using the createEntityIcon.

P.S: RS Guide is mostly 6.

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] HeadIcons
item.dc:creator: @arham_4 arham 4
item.description:
@arham_4 wrote:

Make a new class and name is Interface. Fix the imports and packaging also…

package org.cleaned.rs2.model.quests.tutorial;

import org.cleaned.rs2.model.Client;

/**
 * Interfaces
 *
 * @author Arham 4
 */
public class Interface {

	/**
	 * Creates a flashing yellow arrow on certain coordinate
	 * 
	 * @param x
	 * @param y
	 * @param h
	 * @param pos
	 */
	public void createCoordIcon(int x, int y, int h, Client c) {
		createArrow(x, y, h, 2, c);
	}

	/**
	 * createArrow method for simpler arrow methods
	 * 
	 * @param type
	 * @param id
	 * @param c
	 */
	public static void createArrow(int type, int id, Client c) {
		Client.outStream.createFrame(254); // The packet ID
		Client.outStream.writeByte(type); // 1=NPC, 10=Player
		Client.outStream.writeWord(id); // NPC/Player ID
		Client.outStream.write3Byte(0); // Junk
	}

	/**
	 * createArrow method for simple arrow methods
	 * 
	 * @param x
	 * @param y
	 * @param height
	 * @param pos
	 * @param c
	 */
	public static void createArrow(int x, int y, int height, int pos, Client c) {
		Client.outStream.createFrame(254); // The packet ID
		Client.outStream.writeByte(pos); // Position on Square(2 = middle, 3 =
											// west, 4 = east, 5 = south, 6 =
											// north)
		Client.outStream.writeWord(x); // X-Coord of Object
		Client.outStream.writeWord(y); // Y-Coord of Object
		Client.outStream.writeByte(height); // Height off Ground
	}

	/**
	 * Adds side bar menu to the client
	 * 
	 * @param menuId
	 * @param form
	 * @param c
	 */
	public static void setSideBarMenu(int menuId, int form, Client c) {
		c.setSidebarInterface(menuId, form);
	}

	/**
	 * Creates a flashing yellow icon on a specific npc
	 * 
	 * @param c
	 * @param EntityIndex
	 *            defines which npc
	 * @param c
	 */
	public static void createEntityIcon(Client c, int EntityIndex) {
		createArrow(1, EntityIndex, c);
	}

	/**
	 * Removes a flashing yellow icon from a specific npc
	 * 
	 * @param c
	 * @param EntityIndex
	 *            defines the npc
	 * @param c
	 */
	public static void removeEntityIcon(Client c, int EntityIndex) {
		createArrow(0, EntityIndex, c);
	}
}

For

[quote=“matiasmunk2, post:1, topic:465973”]getPA().drawHeadicon(1, 945, 0, 0);

No arrow appears.[/quote]

[hr]

Now for,

[quote=“matiasmunk2, post:1, topic:465973”]Hey, I’m having problems with Headicons for my server.
This is in my login method in Client.java

Server.npcHandler.spawnNpc(this, 945, 3095, 3108, 0, 1, 0, 0, 0, 0, false, true);

But everytime a new player logs in, it makes a new RuneScape Guide.
I need there to be only 1. Please help?[/quote]

Now, make the npc spawn via npc-spawn.cfg as that will spawn only one and that will stay.

Read full topic
